availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Orlean Bishop (Hopkins County, Ky, county court clerk )

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, court clerk. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah J. Bishop. Father of Mary A. Bishop, Marcellus W. Bishop, Emeline S. Bishop, Ada C. Bishop, and Sarah S. Bishop. Deputy clerk in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned ten enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1850. County court clerk in Hopkins County in 1860. Owned twelve enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 168A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 716.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 807.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 218B-219A.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Hopkins County Executor's Bonds, 1852-1932, p. 108.
"Orlean Bishop (1811-1862)," Find A Grave, Memorial #111077719, accessed September 29, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/111077719.
